The commented text is overlined in red (stops after fol. 59b). On some pages, the text is enclosed within a frame of one red line (see fol. 46b-47a). Glazed paper with laid and chain lines visible (the latter horizontal and grouped by three and four; vertical from fol. 58). Some leaves are later replacements (fol. 4; 6; 7; 9; 11; 16; 17; these later leaves are European glazed paper with watermark). note: Ms. composite codex.|Title from fol. 1a, 8b, spine label, by a later hand.|Ms. incorrectly foliated beginning on first flyleaf; record follows incorrect foliation.|Physical description: Text 1 is 16 lines per page; written in neat naskh in black on tan wove paper. Headings in large script and overlined; catchwords. Chart on fol. 16a. Text 2 is 14 lines per page; written in neat naskh on glazed, laid European paper. Original text overlined in red; catchwords. Fol. 68b-71b blank; note on fol. 7b. Some paper repairs, smudging, and staining.|Origin: Text 2 completed on a Friday during Muḥarram 125[0?] (fol. 188b).

subject_as_recorded: Bible. New Testament. Matthew XXI, 33--Sermons|Monenergism|Celibacy--Christianity--Early works to 1800|Predestination--Early works to 1800|Consolation--Early works to 1800|Astronomy, Arab--Early works to 1800|Aleppo (Syria)--History--17th century
note: Fols. 156; 20 x 14.6 cm.; written surface 15.3 x 8.9 cm.; 17 lines to page; on glazed European paper; in naskhi; with vowel signs; with catchwords; entries in red.|A collection containing:|(1) A treatise on Christian theology entitled al-Burhān fī tathbīt al-īmān, a translation by ʻAbd Allāh ibn al-Faḍl ibn ʻAbd Allāh, the son of the bishop of Antioch, from the original Greek text of Sophronius, known as Fam al-Masīḥ, d. after A.D. 637. The treatise gives a resumé of the work of the first six church councils and the fundamentals of the Christian faith.|Beg.: بسم الله ... کتاب البرهان في تثبىت الاىمان وهو|Colophon: فهذا ما انعم به علىنا واهب الخىرات المسىح الاهنا تعالى وفتح فانا لامانة البرهان على الاراء الصحىحة السلىمة وابادة فساد المذاهب الوخىمة الذي له المجد مع الاب والروح القدس الان ودائما الى اباد الدهور کلها امىن|(2) A treatise on celibacy entitled Maqālah sābiʻah wa-tisʻīn fī-al-batūlīyah by Yūḥannā al-Dimashqī (John of Damascus) d. before A.D. 754.|(3) Another treatise on celibacy entitled Risālah fī faḍīlat al-ʻiffah ʻan al-jimāʻ by Īliyā, bishop of Nusaybin (Turkey), sent to his brother, Abū Saʻīd Manṣūr ibn ʻĪsá. In this treatise the author refutes a saying about the impossibility of refraining from sexual intercourse stated in Kitāb al-Ḥayawān of al-Jāḥiẓ, A.H. 255 [A.D. 868/9].|(4) A treatise on the pre-determination of oneʼs age and provision for living, in the form of an answer to a question put to the Anbā Būluṣ, by Fakhr al-Dawlah ibn Yalmūs al-Kabūrī when the former was about to be ordained bishop of Cairo.|Beg.: بسم الله ... مسألة سألها الشىخ فخر الدولة بن ىلموس|Colophon: تم جواب القدىس انبا بولص والسبح لله دائما. تم|(5) A sermon about the cure for sorrow entitled Ṭibb al-ghamm wa-shifāʼ al-ḥuzn wa-al-hamm. The place for the name of the author is left blank.|(6) A sermon on the text, ʻʻThere was a certain householder which planted a vineyard and hedged it round about and digged a winepress in it and built a towerʼʼ, Matthew 21:33.|(7) A treatise on the computation of the cycles of the sun and the moon entitled Ḥisāb al-kuklus al-shamsī wa-al-qamarī. The treatise calculates the time of fasts and feasts and other ecclesiastical occasions from the year 7160 7215 of the creation.|(8) A poem about the events that happened in Aleppo A.H. 1065 [A.D. 1655] by ʻUbayd Allāh.|MS in good condition; Arabic leather binding.|Acquired from Brill, Leyden, A.D. 1900.

subject_as_recorded: Almucantar--Early works to 1800|Astrolabes--Early works to 1800|Astronomy, Arab--Tables|Astronomy, Arab--Early works to 1800|Astronomy--Turkey--Early works to 1800|Quadrants (Astronomical instruments)--Early works to 1800|Timekeeping--Early works to 1800
note: Fols. 250; 19.5-21.5 x 15.4-16 cm.; written surface 14-16 x 5-9 cm.; 19 lines to page; on glazed European paper; in naskhi and Fārisi; with catchwords; entries in red.|A collection containing:|1. Astronomical tables.|2. An astronomical treatise in Turkish entitled Risālat aqālīm.|3. A general work on astronomy abridged from the works of Abū ʻAbd Allāh Muḥammad al-Māridīnī.|4. A work on the astrolabe. Copied in ʻAyntāb, A.H. 1144 [A.D. 1731], by Muḥammad ibn Maḥmūd ʻAbd al-Ghanī ibn Muṣṭafá al-Marʻashī.|5. Risālah fī al-ʻamal bi-al-rubʻ al-marsūm bi-rubʻ al-muqanṭarāt, an astronomical treatise by Shihāb al-Dīn Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-Majdī, A.H. 850 [A.D. 1447]. See Ahlwardt, Verzeichnis der arabischen Handschriften, 5846.|6. A treatise on determining the hours of the day and the night by means of al-rubʻ al-mujayyab, by Yaḥyá ibn Muḥammad Khaṭṭāb, fl. ca. A.H. 1060 [A.D. 1650]. See Ahlwardt, Verzeichnis der arabischen Handschriften, 5826. The copy was made A.H. 1133 [A.D. 1721].|7. Kifāyat al-qunūʻ fī al-ʻamal bi-al-rubʻ al-maqṭūʻ, a manual of astronomy by Badr al-Dīn Sibṭ al-Māridīnī, d. after A.H. 891 [A.D. 1486]. Ahlwardt, Verzeichnis der arabischen Handschriften, 5848. The copy was made in A.H. 1134 [A.D. 1722] by Muḥammad al-Marʻashī.|8. Another astronomical treatise on al-rubʻ al-mujayyab. Copied A.H. 1134 [A.D. 1722] by the same al-Marʻashī.|9. Another treatise on the same subject. Copied in the same year and by the same copyist.|10. A treatise on the astrolabe. Copied A.H. 1143 [A.D. 1731] by the same al-Marʻashī.|11. Risālah fī al-ʻamal bi-al-rubʻ al-mujayyab by the same al-Māridīnī. See Ahlwardt, Verzeichnis der arabischen Handschriften, 5818. Copy made in A.H. 1133 [A.D. 1721] by the same al-Marʻashī.|12. A treatise on the twenty-eight homes of the moon and on determining the hours of the night. Copied A.H. 1134 [A.D. 1722] by the same copyist.|13. A short treatise on astronomy. Copied A.H. 1139 [A.D. 1726] by the same al-Marʻashī.|14. Mūḍiḥ al-awqāt, an astronomical manual by Muḥammad ibn Kātib Sinān al-Muwaqqit. Copied A.H. 1144 [A.D. 1731] by the same copyist.|15. Hidāyat al-ʻāmil, another treatise on astronomy by the same al-Māridīnī. See Ahlwardt, Verzeichnis der arabischen Handschriften, 5853. Copied A.H. 1151 [A.D. 1738/9].|16. Another astronomical work on al-rubʻ al-mujayyab. Copied A.H. 1145 [A.D. 1732].|17. An explanatory note on al-dāʼirah al-Hindīyah.|18. Another gloss on the same subject by Ṣadr al-Dīn ibn Rūḥ al-Dīn ibn Ṣadr al-Dīn of Sharwān.|19. Bahjat al-albāb fī ʻilm al-asṭurlāb, a treatise on the astrolabe. Incomplete at the end.|20. Risālat al-jayb al-jāmiʻah, an astronomical treatise by Maḥmūd ibn Muḥammad Mīram Chalabī, A.H. 931 [A.D. 1525]. See Ahlwardt, Verzeichnis der arabischen Handschriften, 5855.|21. Same as text 14.|22. Kitāb al-ʻAmal bi-al-kurah, an essay on the use of the instrument dhāt al-kursī, by Qusṭā ibn Lūqā. See Ahlwardt, Verzeichnis der arabischen Handschriften, 5836.|Marginal notes; ruled marginal notes in red in some of the works. MS in fair condition; Arabic binding with flap. XVIIIth century.|Acquired from Bārūdī, Beirūt, A.D. 1925.

subject_as_recorded: Qāḍīʹzādah, Mūsá ibn Muḥammad, -approximately 1436. Sharḥ Mulakhkhaṣ fī al-hayʼah|Jighmīnī, Maḥmūd ibn Muḥammad, -1221? Mulakhkhaṣ fī al-hayʼah|ʻĀmilī, Bahāʾ al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn Ḥusayn, 1547-1621. Khulāṣat al-ḥisāb|Samarqandī, Muḥammad ibn Ashraf, active 13th century. Ashkāl al-taʼsīs|Astrolabes--Early works to 1800|Astronomy, Arab--Early works to 1800|Calendar, Chinese--Early works to 1800|Geometry--Early works to 1800|Mathematics, Arab--Early works to 1800|Quadrants (Astronomical instruments)--Early works to 1800
note: Fols. 295; 21.7 x 15.3 cm.; written surface 14-15 x 6.5-8.7 cm.; 17-19 lines to page; on glazed European paper; in Fārisi; with catchwords; entries in red.|A collection containing:|1. Ḥāshiyah ʻalá Sharḥ al-Mulakhkhaṣ fī al-hayʼah, by ʻAbd al-ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad ibn Ḥusayn al-Birjandī, gloss on the commentary of Mūsá ibn Maḥmūd al-Rūmī Qāḍīʹzādah on al-Mulakhkhaṣ fī al-hayʼah.|2. Sharḥ Khulāṣat al-ḥisāb, by ʻUmar ibn Aḥmad Chillī, a commentary on Bahāʼ al-Dīn al-ʻĀmilī's treatise on mathematics.|3. A fragment of a commentary on Ashkāl al-taʼsīs.|4. Sharḥ AshkāI al-taʼsīs, by Qāḍīʹzādah. On two folios following is a fragment of a work on geometry. The name Saʻd al-Dīn al-Taftāzānī, A.H. 792 [A.D. 1390] appears in the colophon of this fragment.|5. Risālah fī asmāʼ rusūm al-asṭurlāb wa-baʻḍ aʻmālihā. Treatise on the astrolabe comprising an introduction, 15 chapters (faṣl) and a conclusion, giving the names of its parts and segments and the instructions as to its use. The name of the author is mentioned as being Ibn al-Shāṭir in Islamic Manuscripts, Garrett no. 1066Y (1131H.). All other copies are anonymous.|6. Hidāyat al-ʻāmil bi-al-rubʻ al-kāmil, an astronomical treatise on the full quadrant, by Badr al-Dīn Sibṭ al-Māridīnī d. after A.H. 891 [A.D. 1486]. See Ahlwardt, Verzeichnis der arabischen Handschriften, 5853. Title appears as Risālat Muqanṭarāt.|7. Risālah fī al-ʻamal bi-al-rubʻ al-mujayyab, an astronomical treatise on the use of the sinical quadrant, by the same al-Māridīnī. Ḥājjī Khalīfah, Kashf al-ẓunūn (1835-58), III, p. 388; Ahlwardt, Verzeichnis der arabischen Handschriften, 5818.|8. Risālah fī al-usṭurlāb, by Suwaylamʹzādah.|9. Risālah-i sāl-i Turkān, a short treatise on the Chinese zodiac.|Marginal and interlinear notes and glosses. Ruled marginal lines in red in the last six works. Several works in the collection are illustrated with well-drawn diagrams. Works (5) and (6) were copied in Diyārbakr, A.H. 1130 [A.D. 1718], by Muḥammad ibn Mullā Nadhīr al-Makkūdī [?]. Evidently whole collection is from same date and by same hand. MS in good condition; Arabic binding with flap.|Acquired from Bārūdī, Beirūt, A.D. 1925.

note: Fols. 141; 18 x 13 cm.; written surface 13-15 x 9.5-11 cm.; 15-22 lines to page; on glazed Arabic and European paper; in naskhi and Fārisi; with catchwords; with vowel signs; entries in red.|A collection containing:|1. fol. 1b-10a: Risālah mulakhkhaṣah fī al-ʻamal bi-al-rubʻ al-mawḍūʻ, an astronomical treatise on the use of the quadrant with parallel circles by Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd al-Raḥīm al-Mizzī, A.H. 750 [A.D. 1349]. See Ahlwardt, Verzeichnis der arabischen Handschriften, 5841. Probably from XVth century.|3. fol. 21b-28a: Risālah fī al-ʻamal bi-al-rubʻ al-mujayyab, an astronomical treatise on the sine quadrant. See Ahlwardt, Verzeichnis der arabischen Handschriften, 5823. The copy was made in A.H. 825 [A.D. 1422].|4. fol. 29b-93b: al-Durr al-manthūr fī al-ʻamal bi-rubʻ al-dastūr, a treatise on the use of a standard quadrant by Jamāl al-Dīn al-Māridīnī. See Ahlwardt, Verzeichnis der arabischen Handschriften, 5840. The copy was made in ʻUbayh, Lebanon, A.H. 823 [A.D. 1420], by ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad, known as Ibn al-Muhallabī.|5. fol. 94b-104b: Tuḥfah-i Niẓāmīyah, a Persian treatise on the calendar and its relation to astronomy by ʻAbd al-Qādir Rūyānī. In 40 short sections with diagrams. Copy made in A.H. 904 [A.D. 1498/9].|6. fol. 105b-141a: Five astronomical tables. Probably from XVth century.|MS in good condition; Arabic leather binding.|Acquired from Bārūdī, Beirūt, A.D. 1925.

subject_as_recorded: Dawwānī, Muḥammad ibn Asʻad, 1426 or 7-1512 or 13. Sharḥ Tahdhīb al-manṭiq|Taftāzānī, Masʻūd ibn ʻUmar, 1322-1389? Tahdhīb al-manṭiq wa-al-kalām|Ṭāshkubrīʹzādah, Aḥmad ibn Muṣṭafá, 1495-1561. Risālah fī ādāb al-baḥth|Tuḥfat al-mubtadī wa-tabṣirat al-muntahī|Dialectic--Early works to 1800|Logic--Early works to 1800
note: Fols. 150; 18.2 x 10.5 cm.; written surface 12-14 x 5-6 cm.; 15-19 lines to page; on glazed European paper; in Fārisi; with catchwords; entries in red.|A collection containing:|1. ḥāshiyah ʻalá Sharḥ al-Tahdhīb fī al-manṭiq by Mīr Abū al-Fatḥ al-Saʻīdī, a gloss on the commentary of Jalāl al-Dīn al-Dawwānī A.H. 830-907 [A.D. 1426/7-1501/2] on the section on logic in al-Tahdhīb fī al-manṭiq wa-al-kalām, a treatise on logic and metaphysics by Saʻd al-Dīn Masʻūd ibn ʻUmar al-Taftāzānī A.H. 722-792 [A.D. 1322-1390]. Copy was made A.H. 1090 [A.D. 1679].|2. A commentary by Mīr Abū al-Fatḥ al-Saʻīdī, on al-Tahdhīb fī al-kalām, a work on the rules of dialectics by Saʻd al-Dīn al-Taftāzānī, A.H. 792 [A.D. 1390]. Copy probably from late XVIIth century.|3. Sharḥ ʻalá Risālah fī ādāb al-baḥth by Ṭāshkubrīʹzādah, a commentary on the authorʼs own treatise on dialectics entitled, Risālah fī ādāb al-baḥth. Copy probably from XVIIth century.|4. A commentary on Tuḥfat al-mubtadī wa-tabṣirat al-muntahī, a work on the rules of dialectics. Copy probably from XVIIth century.|Marginal notes and glosses. MS in fair condition; Arabic binding with flap.|Acquired from Bārūdī, Beirut, A.D. 1925.

title_as_recorded: Collection of Arabic texts on arithmetic
subject_as_recorded: ʻĀmilī, Bahāʾ al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn Ḥusayn, 1547-1621. Khulāṣat al-ḥisāb|Arithmetic--Early works to 1900|Mathematics, Arab--Early works to 1800
note: Copied in ʻAyntāb and Marʻash A.H. 1135-1143 [A.D. 1723-1731] by Muḥammad ibn Maḥmūd ibn ʻAbd al-Ghanī ibn Muṣṭafá al-Marʻashī.|Fols. 273; 21.2 x 16 cm.; written surface 16 x 8.7 cm.; 23 lines to page; on glazed European paper; in Fārisi; with catchwords; entries in red.|A collection containing:|1. Khulāṣat al-ḥisāb by Bahāʼ al-Dīn al-ʻĀmilī, a compendium of arithmetic.|2. ḥall al-Khulāṣah li-ahl al-riyāsah, a commentary by Ramaḍān ibn Abī Hurayrah al-Jazarī d. after A.H. 1092 [A.D. 1681] on the preceding text. See Fihrist al-kutub al-ʻArabīyah al-maḥfūẓah bi-al-Kutubkhānah al-Khudaywīyah, V, p. 180. Text overlined with red. Stated in original colophon that work was composed A.H. 1076 [A.D. 1665].|3. Another commentary on Khulāṣat al-ḥisāb by ʻUmar ibn Aḥmad, known as al-Māʼ al-Jalī. The groundwork is designated here as al-Bahāʼīyah fī al-ḥisāb.|4. Another commentary on Khulāṣat al-ḥisāb by ʻAbd al-Raḥīm ibn Abī Bakr al-Marʻashī. The groundwork is designated here as al-Risālah al-Bahāʼīyah.|Text overlined with red. Copy illustrated with diagrams. Marginal and interlinear notes and glosses; ruled marginal lines on several folios. MS in good condition; Arabic binding with flap.|Acquired from Bārūdī, Beirūt, A.D. 1925.

subject_as_recorded: ʻĀmilī, Bahāʾ al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn Ḥusayn, 1547-1621. Khulāṣat al-ḥisāb|Mathematics, Arab--Early works to 1800
author_as_recorded: Marʻashī, ʻAbd al-Raḥīm ibn Abī Bakr, d. 1736
note: Copied A.H. 1153 [A.D. 1740].|Fols. 132; 20.2 x 14.2 cm.; written surface 13.5 x 6.4 cm.; 19 lines to page; on glazed European paper; in Fārisi; with catchwords; entries in red.|Marginal notes and glosses. Work is illustrated with diagrams. MS in good condition but wormeaten; Arabic leather binding; blind stamped and tooling.|Acquired from Bārūdī, Beirūt, A.D. 1925.

subject_as_recorded: Ṭūsī, Naṣīr al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad, 1201-1274. Tadhkirah fī ʻilm al-hayʼah|Astronomy, Arab--Early works to 1800|Geometry--Early works to 1800|Mathematics, Arab--Early works to 1800|Metaphysics--Early works to 1800|Physics--Early works to 1800
note: Fols. 335; 22.3 x 12 cm.; written surface 13-15 x 6.3-7.7 cm.; 17-25 lines to page; on glazed Arabic paper; in Fārisi; with catchwords.|A collection containing:|1. Tawḍīḥ al-Tadhkirah [al-Nāṣirīyah], a commentary by al-ḥasan ibn Muḥammad, known as Niẓām al-Dīn al-Naysābūrī d. ca. A.H. 710 [A.D. 1310/1], on al-Tadhkirah al-Nāṣirīyah, a work on astronomy by Nāṣir al-Dīn al-Ṭūsī, A.H. 672 [A.D. 1274].|Copied A.H. 1011 [A.D. 1602/3] by Manṣūr ibn Maḥmūd al-ḥusaynī al-Samnānī [?]. Work incomplete at beginning. See ḥājjī Khalīfah, Kashf al-ẓunūn (1835-58), II, pp. 268/9; Catalogue des manuscrits arabes de la Bibliothèque Nationale, 2510.|2. al-ḥikmah al-Rashīdīyah fī taḥṣīl al-uṣūl al-ṭabīʻīyah wa-al-ilāhīyah, a work on physics and metaphysics. Copied A.H. 933 [A.D. 1527] by ḥasan al-Jīlānī.|3. al-Fawāʼid al-Bahāʼīyah fī al-qawāʻid al-ḥisābīyah, a treatise on arithmetic and geometry by ʻImād al-Dīn ʻAbd Allāh ibn Muḥammad al-Khaddām al-Baghdādī d. after A.H. 736 [A.D. 1335/6]. See ḥājjī Khalīfah, Kashf al-ẓunūn (1835-58), IV, p. 471; Ahlwardt, Verzeichnis der arabischen Handschriften, 5976. A folio or more is missing between folios 1 and 2. Folio 1 is defective. Probably from XVIth Century.|Marginal and interlinear notes and glosses. MS illustrated with diagrams; in fair condition but worm-eaten; modern Arabic cloth binding.|Acquired from Bārūdī, Beirūt, A.D. 1925.

physical_description: Extent: 155 leaves : paper ; 215 x 141 (160 x 79) mm. bound to 215 x 149 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from fol. 1a.|Physical description: 23 lines per page; written in naskh in black on glazed, laid European paper. Text bordered in black and gold with outer marginal red border. Rubrication and catchwords; extensive marginal notes. Fol. 97-98, 148-149 detached. Light staining and smudging; otherwise in excellent condition.|Origin: Copy completed by Ilyās ibn Murād on Wednesday night, 14 Jumādá II, at the Madrasat al-Muftī in Bolu (fol. 154b). The scribe relates that he was previously in Istanbul, but when he fell ill he came to Bolu to improve his health. He had a fever for twenty days, then when the fever subsided he began copying this manuscript. Ms. is likely from the 18th century.|On fol. 1a, owner's note by Muḥammad ʻAṭā Allāh ibn Isḥāq.

subject_as_recorded: Medicine, Arab|Pharmacopoeias--Islamic Empire
physical_description: Extent: i, 117, i leaves : paper ; 288 x 192 (199-210 x 119) mm. bound to 291 x 200 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from fol. 1a by a later hand, where it is attributed to one al-Qurṭubī.|Physical description: 21-22 lines per page; written in maghribi in black on glazed, laid European paper with VI watermark. Headings in red or blue in large script. Some staining and a few paper repairs; small portion of text blurred by water damage on fol. 1-3. Lacunae after fol. 63, 106, 114. Ms. is bound out of order; correct order is as follows: 1-48, 105-106, 64-73, 49-50, 74-91, 115-116, 107-114, 92-104, 51-63, 117 (this folio may belong elsewhere in ms.).

physical_description: Extent: 187 leaves: paper ; 170 x 85 (112 x 50) mm. bound to 170 x 90 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from inscription on the upper margin of fol. 3b. The title appears on a label pasted on the fore-edge flap of the slipcase as "Matn Mūjiz min al-ṭibb".|Incipit: قال الشيخ الامام الحبر قدوة العلاما ورئيس الحكماء فريد دهره ووحيد عصره ابو الحسين علاء الدين علي ابن ابى الحسن القرشى المتطبّب قدس الله روحه وبعد فقد رتّبت هذا الكتاب علي اربعة فنون الفن الاول فى قواعد جزءى الطب اعنى علمية وعملية بقول كلى|Explicit: وكان تدبيرهم واحدا و استعملوا دواء جالينوس وغيره من العلاج المذكور تم الكتاب|Physical description: 17 lines per page. Written in medium small nastaʻlīq in black ink with use of red for the basmalah, headings and overlining. Soft dark cream paper with laid and chain lines and pulp visible. Fol. 1-2 and 186-187 are later additions, with inscriptions. Marginal annotations. Topics written vertically in red on the margins.|Collation: Paper, fol. 187 ; 18 (-2 at the beginning of the quire ; + 2 later added leaves, European paper, fol. 1-2) 2-228 238 (+1 ; +2 later added leaves, European paper).|Origin: Copy completed at the end of Rabīʻ al-Ākhar 795 [March 1393] by Masʻūd ibn Muḥammad al-Qazwīnī (colophon, fol. 178b).|Acquired by Robert Garrett from Brill, Leyden, 1900.

physical_description: Extent: ii, 56, ii leaves: paper ; 207 x 117 (145 x 70) mm bound to 212 x 120 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from note by a later hand on fol. 2a.|Marginal annotations. Inscription on a label pasted on the upper cover: "74 [in Arabic numerals] 1100 [in Western numerals]". Inscriptions on fol. 2a, including lists of names of authors on astronomy.|Collation: Paper, fol. ii, 56, ii ; i (free endpaper) i (endpaper ; European paper) 18 (+1 in European paper, before the first fol. of the quire) 2-68 78 (-1, after the last fol. of the quire) i (endpaper ; European paper with watermark) i (free endpaper) ; catchword on the verso of each leaf.|Layout: 25 lines per page.|Description: Written in casual thin taʻlīq in black ink. Cream paper, glossy, with thick laid lines and pulp visible. . Fol. 1 is a later addition, with inscriptions including an excerpt from the Sharḥ-i Gulistān by al-Surūrī (1492-1562), on fol. 1a. Fol. 2 consists of a later addition pasted on the recto of an original folio.|Origin: According to the colophon, autograph copy by Kamāl al-Tūrkānī, 26 Ramaḍān 755 [Oct. 14, 1354] in Madīnat Gulistān (fol. 53a). However, see also Princeton University Library. Islamic mss., Garrett no. 66B.|Acquired by Robert Garrett from Brill, Leyden, 1900.

author_as_recorded: Ibn Jumayʻ, Hibat Allāh ibn Zayn, -1198
author_as_recorded_agr: ابن جميع، هبة الله بن زين
physical_description: Extent: 120 leaves : paper ; 230 x 160 (160 x 110) mm. bound to 230 x 165 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from title page (fol. 1a). The same title appears in the preamble of the text (fol. 2a, l. 12-13).|Incipit: قال هبة الله كنت يا سيّدى اطال الله بقاك ... فاوضتنى فى امر كتاب الريس ابى على بن عبد الله بن سينا الملقّب بالقانون ذكرت ما بلغك ... [2أ] ... الجملة الاولى في القول المجمل على جملة الكتاب وحواشيه العراقية والاشارة الى السبيل التى سلكها فى اصلاحه|Explicit: المقالة السادسة ... كان جالينوس يستعمله الحواشى العراقية هذه نسخة الفاوينا الرومية بعينها وقد سلف ذكرها فى باب المعاجين مقادير المفردات هناك غير هذه هذا اخر ما فيّد من الحواشي على الكتاب الخامس من القانون وقد تمّ الكلام على جميع الكتاب على ما شرطه المولف وبتمامها تم الكتاب ولله المجد والمنة سرمدًا|Physical description: 25 lines per page. Written in casual naskh in black ink with use of red. Cream paper, glossy, with thick laid lines (vertical) and a few chain lines, and pulp, visible ; laid lines visible on the surface. Several inscriptions on fol. 1a. Title on tail of text block.|Collation: Paper, fol. 120 ; 110 (-1, before the first fol.) 2-1110 1210 (+1, after last fol.) ; the quires are numbered (cut off due to the trimming of the leaves).|Origin: According to colophon, copy completed in al-Qāhirah al-ʻAbbāsīyah, fī al-Dawlah al-ʻādilīyah, on the last day (salkh) of Shaʻbān 600 [May 1204], from an autograph. The copyist adds that he did not collate the manuscript (colophon, fol. 120a).|Inscription in Western numerals on the pastedown of the upper cover: "883" (corresponds to Brill's list. See Houtsma, M. Th. Catalogue d'une collection de manuscrits arabes et turcs, no. 556).|Other shelfmark: This ms. is also known as New Series 2017 (see Mach, R. and E. Ormsby. Handlist (New Series), no. 1526)|Ownership statements on fol. 1a, including one dated Jumādá al-Awwal 890 [May-June 1485] in the name of Sayyid Khaṭṭābī al-Munajjim al-Māzandarānī in Sīrūz (fī bilād al-Yūnān) [Serez, Macedonia], who bought the copy for 55 Ottoman Dirhams ; one in the name of Manṣūr ibn Ibrāhīm al-Mutaṭabbib al-Masīḥī. Acquired from Brill, Leyden, 1900.

author_as_recorded: Khāṭirī, Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad
note: Fols. 32; 16.8 x 11.5 cm.; written surface 13.7 x 8 cm.; 16 lines to page; on glazed Arabic paper; in naskhi; entries in red.|A work on geometry compiled from the Elements of Euclid, who flourished B.C. 323-285, the Almagest of Ptolemy d. after A.D. 161, and the Method of Archimedes b. ca. B.C. 287 and d. B.C. 212.|Beg.: بسم الله ... الحمد لله الذي کملنا بعقل الفعال|Colophon: ونختم الرسالة بهذا الباب والله اعلم واحکم بالحقىقة|Ruled marginal lines in red. Writing parallel to back of binding. Attached to MS are 44 folios containing a treatise on magic dealing with the properties of the ring of Ṣāliḥ, and another on numbers and their squares, both in Persian and copied A.H. 609 [A.D. 1212]. MS is old and belongs probably to the first half of the XIIIth century. In fair condition; very rare.|Acquired from Brill, Leyden, A.D. 1900.

author_as_recorded: Qāḍīʹzādah, Mūsá ibn Muḥammad, -approximately 1436
note: Fols. 29; 17.6 x 13.7 cm.; written surface 12.5 x 7 cm.; 19 lines to page; on glazed European paper; in naskhi; with few vowel signs; with catchwords.|A commentary on Ashkāl al-taʼsīs, a compendium of geometry modeled after the Elements of Euclid by Shams al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn Ashraf al-Ḥusaynī al-Samarqandī, ca. A.H. 600 [A.D. 1203/4]. The present work was composed for Ulugh Bey, A.D. 1449.|Beg.: وصفا اعني حضر ... وبعد فان جماعة من الفضلاء|Colophon: وذلك ما اردناه وهذه الاشکال الخمسة الاخىرة من ثانىة کتاب الاصول لاقلىدس الصوري ولىکن هذا آخر الکلام والحمد لله على الاتمام|Marginal and interlinear notes and glosses. Work fully illustrated with diagrams. Title appears as Kitāb al-Uṣūl li-Uqlīdis. MS incomplete at beginning; in good condition but mended; Arabic binding. Probably from XVIth century.|Acquired from Bārūdī, Beirūt, A.D. 1925.|Ḥājjī Khalīfah, Kashf al-ẓunūn (1835-58), I, p. 322; Ahlwardt, Verzeichnis der arabischen Handschriften, 5943/4; Pertsch, Die orientalischen handschriften der Herzoglichen bibliothek zu Gotha, 1498.

subject_as_recorded: Medicine, Arab|Manuscripts, Arabic--New Jersey--Princeton
author_as_recorded: Majūsī, ʻAlī ibn al-ʻAbbās, active 10th century-11th century
physical_description: Extent: 356 leaves : paper ; 295 x 215 (225 x 160) mm. bound to 350 x 250 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from rubric (fol. 1b).|Opening rubric: كتاب كامل الصناعة الطبية المعروف بالملكي تاليف علي بن العباس تلميد ابي ماهر موسي ابن سيار للملك عضد الدولة(؟) رحمة الله عليه|Incipit: المقالة الاولى و هي كه [25] بابا الباب الاول في صدر الكتاب الباب الثاني ... الباب الاول في صدر الكتاب قال علي ابن عباس ان احق ما ابتدي به في جميع الامور|Explicit: مثقال مع شيء من شراب العسل نافع ان شاء الله تعالى|31 long lines per page. Very dense copy written in small naskh using black ink, with headings in red (maqāmah headings in larger script using black ink); collation notes in violet ink and black ink in juzʼ 1 (fol. 149a, on the margin, using the same violet ink: "بلغت المقابلة بحمد اللة ومنه في صفر سنة 588"); in black ink in juzʼ 2 (violet ink on fol. 231a). Glazed paper with visible laid lines and single vertical chain lines (irregular, 180 to 250 mm., often curved); frame-ruled (12 mm.). Catchword only on fol. 87b. The pages have been trimmed so that parts of the marginalia are cut off. Some pages are repaired (loss of text and marginalia on fol. 353 a-b). Two foliations: one in black ink using Arabic numerals and one in pencil using Western numerals. Excellent condition except for a few holes. Fol. 234 and 235 are glued together ; fol. 83 is a modern addition replacing a missing leaf.|Each maqālah begins with a table of contents using abjad.|Copied from a faulty copy ("min nuskhah saqīmah") by Barakāt ibn Thābit(?) ibn Ḥamd(?) ibn Barakāt ibn Bakār(?) in Ḥarrān during the first ten days of Dhū al-Qaʻdah 586 (colophon).|Ownership statements and seals on fol. 1a (4 inscriptions and 4 seals) and 353b (2 inscriptions and 1 seal). Some of the inscriptions link this copy to Iran.

author_as_recorded: Dawwānī, Muḥammad ibn Asʻad, 1426 or 1427-1512 or 1513
physical_description: Extent: 57 leaves : paper ; 170 x 97 (120 x 57) mm. bound to 173 x 105 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from fol. 3a.|Physical description: 15 lines per page. Written in clear small naskh in black ink. The text is framed within a gilt and blue border. Illuminated headpiece (ʻunwān) in blue, green, red and gold on fol. 3b. Dark cream paper with laid lines visible. Catchword on the verso of most leaves. On fol. 1a: Inscriptions and one seal. On fol. 2a: Inscriptions ; verses of poetry in Persian. On fol. 3a: Short excerpts ; title ; two seals. On fol. 57b: Arḍ notes dated 3 Rajab 910, 17 Jumādá al-Awwal 912, 25 Jumādá al-Awwal 919, 24 Rabīʻ al-Awwal 925, 15 Rabīʻ al-Ākhir 934 ; two seals, one dated 1113 H.|Origin: Copied by Aḥmad ibn ʻAlī in 902 H. (colophon, fol. 57a).

author_as_recorded: Avicenna, 980-1037
physical_description: Extent: ii + 360 + i leaves : paper ; 245 x 170 (180 x 115) mm. bound to 245 x 180 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from tail of text block.|21 lines per page. Written in black ink with use of red, magenta and gold. Illuminated headpieces on fol. 1b (damaged), with inscription in white "Kufic" reading: "al-Mujallad al-rābiʻ", and on fol. 266b, reading: "al-Mujallad al-khāmis". The text is framed within a gold, black and blue border. Thin light cream glazed paper.|The headpiece reminds of that in the ms. described by David James. After Timur (1992), no. 8, p. 40-41.|Last folios worm-eaten and crudly repaired, with loss of text. Fragile.|Copy completed on Saturday 4 Rajab 882 [Oct. 1477] (colophon, fol. 360b, followed by two verses of poetry in Arabic). See also colophon of al-Kitāb al-Rābiʻ on fol. 265b.

author_as_recorded: Irbilī, Muḥammad ibn al-Khaṭīb
physical_description: Extent: 29, i leaves : paper ; 153 x 115 (110 x 85) mm. bound to 155 x 115 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from preamble (fol. 1b, l. 14-15). The same title appears on a modern label pasted on the spine (horizontal). The name of the author is supplied by the cataloger, according to Kashf al-ẓunūn, ed. Fluegel, vol. III, p. 202 and vol. VI, p. 402.|17 lines per page. Written in careful professional naskh in black ink with use of red for headings and re-inking. Red circle text-stops. Thick cream paper, glossy, with laid lines and pulp visible. Catchword on the verso of the leaves at the beginning of a quire.|According to the colophon, copy completed by Safarshāh ibn al-Ḥājī(?) ibn Muḥammad al-Jīlī on Yawm al-Ithnayn 14 Shawwāl 765 [July 15, 1364] in Dār al-Salām Baghdād. The date "765" is added apparently by another hand on an erased line (fol. 29b).|Ownership statement in the name of Qāsim, son of (najal) Muḥammad Maṭr al-Khādim, dated 1152 H. [1739 or 40] on fol. 29b. Seal on fol. 1b.

note: Ms. codex.|Title from beginning of text (fol. 3b, l. 17 [2b in the faulty modern foliation]). The name of the author appears in the colophon.|Incipit: احمد الله مبدء كل مبتء وغاية كل غاية ... وبعد فقد كنت برهة من الزمان عازما على ان احرّر لنفسي ولساير طلبة العلم من الاخوان كتاب المجسطي المنسوب الى بطلميوس ... وها انا اخوض فى المقصود واقول الكتاب مشتمل على ثلثة عشر مقالة|Explicit: قال واذا اتممنا جميع ما يفتقر الى ارشاده من وجود ما يحتاج الى وجوده وتصحيح ما يحتاج الى تصحيحه ... حامدا له على الاته مصليا على جميع اوليائه خصوصا على خاتم انبيائه وبرزة من اله واهليائه|Physical description: 27 lines per page. Written in small naskh with elements of nastaʻlīq in black ink with use of magenta and red. The text is framed within two lines in magenta, with a pagination in Arabic numerals in the middle of the top of the frame (starts with "2" on fol. 3b). Contains diagrams, tables and figures. Collation notes on the margins. Jadwal on a leaf pasted between fol. 8 and 9. Table of contents on fol. 1b-2b [-1b in the faulty modern foliation] by the same hand as the main text (whose name is given as Muḥammad ibn Ṭāhir ibn ... ibn Muḥammad al-... al-Faḍlī in the colophon of the Fihrist, fol. 2b). Title in Arabic script on a spine label (horizontal): "Majisṭī". Modern foliation in pencil using Western numerals (omits the first fol.).|Inscription in Arabic script in red pencil on fol. 1a: "Raqm 43".|Origin: Copy completed on Friday 19 Dhū al-Qaʻdah 1324 [Jan. 4, 1907] by Muḥammad ibn Ṭāhir ibn al-Ḥabīb(?) ibn al-Muḥsin ibn al-Ḥusayn ibn Turkī al-Faḍlī (colophon, fol. 94a [93a in the faulty modern foliation]). According to a note on the left margin of the colophon, this copy was collated with an autograph copy.|From the books of al-Hādī, Āl Kāshif al-Ghiṭāʼ al-Najafī, dated 1332 H. [1913 or 14] (ex libris on fol. 3a, [2a in the faulty modern foliation]). Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.

author_as_recorded: Ṭūsī, Naṣīr al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad, 1201-1274
author_as_recorded_agr: طوسي، نصير الدين محمد بن محمد
physical_description: Extent: 156 leaves : paper, ill. ; 165 x 125 mm. bound to 165 x 125 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the fore-edge flap (horizontal). The name of the author of the first text appears in a note on the right margin of fol. 56b.|Physical description: 17 lines per page. Written in black and red ink. Contains diagrams and tables. Light cream paper with pulp, laid and chain lines visible. Several leaves wanting at the beginning of the copy (only inner upper corner is extant), and between fol. 74 and 75. Severely worm damaged. On fol. 153b: Short excerpt apparently by the same hand as the main text. Fol. 154 and 155 are later added endpapers, with a short excerpt from Kitāb Aṣl al-uṣūl by al-Ṣaymarī written by alater hand. Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the upper cover (horizontal): "ʻIlm al-ḥisāb ... 17 ...".|Origin: Text 1 copied in Tabrīz by al-Qāḍī Ḥasan ibn al-Ḥusayn Shahinshāh al-Simnānī, on Saturday 2 Muḥarram 716 [March 27, 1316] (colophon, fol. 56b). Text 3 copied by the same (or: Ḥusayn ibn al-Ḥasan?) in the Madrasat al-Saʻīd sulṭān al-ʻadl wa-al-iḥsān Ghāzān, called al-Ḥanafīyah, in Tabrīz on Saturday 26 Ramaḍān 714 [Jan. 3, 1315] (colophon, fol. 153a). A note on the left margin adds that the text was copied from a copy by Burhān al-millah wa-al-dīn ʻUbayd Allāh al-ʻIbrī.

subject_as_recorded: Humāmī, Aḥmad ibn Thābit, d. 1233 or 4. Ghunyat al-ḥussāb fī ʻilm al-ḥisāb|Mathematics, Arab--16th century|Mathematicians, Arab--Certification--History--16th century--Sources|Muslim scholars--Certification--History--16th century--Sources|Manuscripts, Arabic--New Jersey--Princeton|Manuscrits arabes--New Jersey--Princeton|Manuscripts, Arabic|Mathematics, Arab|New Jersey--Princeton|1500-1599
author_as_recorded: Ibn al-Ḥanbalī, Muḥammad ibn Ibrāhīm, 1502 or 1503-1563
physical_description: Extent: 97 leaves: paper, ill. ; 180 x 135 (110 x 80) mm. bound to 180 x 140 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from note by a later hand on fol. 1a. The same title with no statement of responsibility appears in the preamble of the text (fol. 2a, last line).|Beginning as extant: على الكفاية تعلّمها المثاب ان شاء الله تعالي معلّمها ومتعلّمها الي ان لاحت الملاحة في وجه كتاب المساحة من كتاب غنية الحسّاب في علم الحساب تاليف عمدة الاثبات جمال الدين احمد بن ثَبات ذي العوارف الهمامية المعروف بقاضي الهُمامية ... [2ب] ... قال المصنّف رحمه الله تعالى كتاب المساحة بكسر الميم قيل هي استعلام امثال الواحد المفوض الخطي|Explicit: وان شيت بالنسبة فما خرج فهو الجواب والله اعلم بالصواب وصلى الله علي محمد واله وصحبه وسلم تسليما قال شيخنا العلامم نفع الله به شارح هذه ... الميمونة وكان الفراغ من وضع هذا الشرح [96أ] في جمادي الآخره من شهور سنة خمس وخمسين وتسع ماية انتهي|Physical description: 17 lines per page. Written in medium small naskh in black ink with use of red. Contains figures and diagrams. From fol. 64 on, the spaces intended for such diagrams are left blank. Light cream paper with laid and chain lines visible. Fol. 1 is a later addition, with upper corner torn off, with mention of the title and ownership statements. The first folio of the text is wanting. According to the catchword on fol. 9b, one fol. missing between fol. 9 and 10. Title on the tail of the text block: "Fī al-Misāḥah".|Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the upper cover: "Sh ...? 186" (repeated in red pencil on the pastedown of the upper cover). Two spine labels (vertical), one with the inscription in Roman script: "AUT S [next line] 57" (same label on the pastedown of the upper cover, repeated in red pencil on the pastedown itself), the other with the title in Arabic script, reading: "al-Misāḥah".|Origin: Copied by ʻAbd al-Raḥmān in Ramaḍān 961 (colophon, fol. 96a). The copyist adds in a note that he heard this text read by somebody else in front on the author, Shaykhunā al-ʻallāmah Radī al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn al-Ḥanbalī, who gave him an ijāzah, in Dhū al-Qaʻdah of the same year.|Three ownership statements and one seal dated 1265 H. [1848 or 9] on fol. 1a, in the name of Aḥmad Āghā Ibn al-Ḥājj Aḥmad Āghā Sayyid(?, the rest torn off), with indication of a price ; al-Ḥājj Bakrī Ibn Ḥājj Muṣṭafá Ibn al-...(?) ; Yūsuf ibn Muḥammad al-Jamālī(?, obliterated). Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.

physical_description: Extent: 108 leaves, bound : paper, ill. ; 183 x 125 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title and author on title page corresponds to text 4.|Page numbers added in a later hand do not correspond to folio numbers.|Physical description: 16-22 lines per page. Written in naskhī/ruqʻah scripts by different hands in black ink. Catchwords; headings and keywords in red, brown, or violet ink. Diagrams in black, brown, blue, and/or red ink. Some damp staining in margins. Fol. 1b-2a, 3a-9a, 10a-10b, 33a-37b, 41b, 53b, 54b, 64a, 69a, 70a, 83b-85a, 97a-97b, 99a-10a, 128a-128b, 131b, 140a blank. Fol. 2b, 9b, 54a, 69b contain miscellaneous notes. Inner front cover and fol. 140b contain records of births and deaths dated 1348-1374 A.H. (1929-1954). Notes on modern, lined paper inserted between fol. 32b and 33a, 53b and 54a, 89b and 90a, 103b and 104a.

note: ff. 71. 176 x 130; 124 x 75 mm. 15 lin. 14th cen. According to a note by the hand of Muʼayyadzādah al-Āmāsī (cf. Brockelmann, GAL, II, 293sq.) who acquired the present ms. in Jumādá I, 908, it was read before the translator ʻImād al-Dīn ʻAlī al-Qāshī and signed by him. This certificate of reading is now missing, only the date 78[-?] remains of it on the margin of fol. 1.|Brockelmann, GAL, S I, 931 (no. 44a); Chester Beatty Library: A handlist of the Arabic manuscripts, 4933; Mashhad v. 8, p. 175; also Brit. Mus. Suppl. 763/2 contains this work and not the Zubdal al-idrāk (Brockelmann, GAL, I, 675, no. 44; S II, 931) which is a different work.|For the Persian original cf. Storey II, 60.|Divided into 30 bābs:|1: فىما ىجب معرفته قبل الشروع فى هذا العلم|30: فى ذکر منازل القمر وطلوعها وسقوطها|Incip.: ... الحمد لله فاطر السموات ومدوّرها ومبدع الکواکب ومنوّرها ... وبعد فان الاستاذ... الطوسى ... املا مختصرا فى علم الهىئة سماه الزبدة

note: Ms. codex.|Title supplied by cataloger.|17 lines per page. Written in small nastaʻlīq in black ink with use of red for headings and to overline the commented text (gold on the first four pages). European glazed paper with watermark.|Two labels pasted on the upper cover with inscription in Arabic, respectively "Riyāḍiyāt 49" and "662". Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the pastedown of the upper cover: "515 Alif" (or "1505").|Copied by Ḥājj Muḥammad ibn Ḥājj ʻAlī (colophon, fol. 77b).|Ownership statement in the name of al-Sayyid Muḥammad Fāʼiq on fol. 1a. Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.

note: Ms. codex.|Title from inscription on fol. 1a.|Physical description: 17 lines per page. Written in small Maghribī script in black ink with use of red. The text is framed within a single red line on fol. 1b-29a. Annotations and collation notes on the margin. European paper with watermark. On fol. 153a, after the last verse of the commented text, the script changes dramatically for the last two pages. It is unclear whether the previous part of the copy was written at the same time as the date mentioned in the colophon. Inscriptions on fol. (i)a-b, including verses of poetry and a note mentioning the date Rajab 1282. Title on tail of text block (hardly legible). Foliation in black ink using Arabic numerals (omits first fol.).|Origin: According to colophon, copy completed in the middle of Rajab 1286 [Oct. 1869] by its "mukammil", Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad (fol. 154a).|Acquired by Robert Garrett from the books of Murād Bey al-Bārūdī (Beirut), 1925.

author_as_recorded: Averroës, 1126-1198
physical_description: Extent: 135 leaves : paper ; 284 x 207 (206 x 147) mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from colophon (fol. 135a).|Physical description: 18 to 23 lines per page. Written in Maghribī script. Each entry begins with Avicenna's verses in larger script, followed by the commentary. Thick light cream paper ; glossy. Fol. 1 is a later replacement. The verses of the Urjūzah are numbered in Western numerals on the margin (starts over at the beginning of each section). Corrections on the margins by the same hand as the main text and by later hands (see eight lines of missing text provided on the lower margin of fol. 46b-47a by a later hand). Slight loss of Arabic annotations due to the trimming of the leaves. Marginal and interlinear annotations in Latin. [1480] (fol. 135a).|Acquired from Brill, Leyden, 1900, most probably from the collection of Amīn ibn Ḥasan al-Ḥulwānī al-Madanī al-Ḥanafī (Medina).

Mention of a price (qīmat) on fol. 1a.|Copy completed on 4 Rabīʻ I 970 [Nov. 1, 1562] by Sulṭān ʻAlī ibn Ḥasan ʻAlī (date by fractions, colophon, fol. 226b).|Several ownership statements with seals on fol. 1a, with the dates 1120 H., 1152 H., 1336 H. author_as_recorded: Jurjānī, ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad, al-Sayyid al-Sharīf, 1340-1413
author_as_recorded_agr: جرجاني، علي بن محمد السيد الشريف
physical_description: Extent: i, 116, i leaves: paper ; 175 x 125 and 180 x 125 mm. bound to 190 x 130 mm.
note: Ms. composite codex.|Title supplied by cataloger.|First part (fol. 2b-64b) written in elegant small taʻlīq, in black ink, with 19 lines to the page (writing surface: 110 x 65 mm.), on light cream paper with laid and chain lines visible. Second part (fol. 66a-116a) written in thick dense naskh with elements of nastaʻlīq, in black ink with use of red, with 21 lines to the page (writing surface: 125 x 85 mm.), on light cream paper with laid lines visible. Contains figures. Ḥāshīyah on the margins of both texts, apparently by the same hand as the main text. Short excerpt on nature on fol. 66b. Fol. 1 in the modern foliation followed here is a later endpaper with inscriptions. Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the upper cover: "Riyāḍīyāt 53". Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the free endpaper of the upper cover: "Ḥāʼ 482".|Copy of text 2 completed on the first Friday of Shaʻbān 873 by Aḥmad ibn Yūsuf (colophon, fol. 116a, concluded with verses of poetry in Persian).|Purchase statement in Ottoman Turkish on fol. 2a, refering to Seyid Mustafa Efendi (al-Sayyid Muṣṭafá Afandī), mentioning a coffeehouse in Kendili (Istanbul) and a price (40 paras), dated 7 or 17 Jumādá al-Ākhir -92 [892 or 992?]. Ownership statement signed al-faqīr Muḥammad and seal on fol. 67a. Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.

(colophon, fol. 86a).|Collation: Paper, fol. 88 ; 14 + 2-910 (quires 10-17 of the complete ms.) 102 (+1) ; catchword on the verso of each leaf; the quires are numbered using Arabic numerals in the form "10" (see fol. 5a).|Ownership statement signed ʻAbd Allāh Afandī al-Kafawī, known as Tārtār ʻAbd Allāh Afandī on fol. 1a. author_as_recorded: ʻAyntābī, Maḥmūd ibn Aḥmad, 1409-1496
physical_description: Extent: ii, 294, ii leaves: paper ; 270 x 175 (192 x 135) mm. bound to 268 x 180 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from title page (fol. 1a).|Physical description: 27 lines per page. Written in elegant medium large naskh in black ink, with use of red and green ink. The text is framed within a gold and black border on fol. 1b-2a. Thick light cream paper with laid lines and pulp visible. The paper is frame-ruled. Fol. (ii) is a latter addition on glazed European paper with watermark ("Tre Lune"). Marginal annotations. Collation statement stating that the text has been collated with a copy dated 881 H. [1476 or 77] (fol. 292b, lower margin). Kabīkaj on fol. (ii)a. Excerpt attributed to Avicenna on a small piece of paper placed between fol. 63 and 64.|Decoration: Illuminated title page (ʻunwān) in blue, gold, and some red on fol. 1a. A cartouche on the upper part of the page bears the title written in blue(?) on a gold ground and a rinceau in blue. To the left of this cartouche is a small medallion in gold and red. The cartouche and medallion are outlined in blue. The rest of the page has a central large twelve petal roundel executed in blue and gold, and bearing the name of the author in gold. Above and underneath the roundel, is an inscription in gold outlined in black mentioning the name of the patron. The edges of the text block and the upper margin of fol. 1b are decorated with a floral motif in gold.|Collation: Paper, fol. ii, 294, ii ; i (free endpaper) + i (European glazed paper) + 110 (-1, before fol. 1) 2-2910 30 (5 leaves) + i (European glazed paper) +i (free endpaper) ; catchword on the verso of each leaf ; the quires are numbered using Arabic numerals.|Origin: Copy completed on 18 Rabīʻ al-Ākhar 870 [Dec. 8, 1465] by Abū al-Wafā Muḥammad ibn Ismāʻīl (fol. 292b).|Patronage: Copied for Shams al-Dīn al-Qūṣūnī, physician in Cairo (Miṣr) (illuminated title page, fol. 1a).|Three ownership statements on fol. (ii)a, one dated 1152 H. [1739 or 40], another with a seal with the inscription "Muṣṭafá Shawkat". Small circular seal with floral motif and mention "Madyan". on fol. 292b. Inscription "S26" in Roman script, in black ink on the pastedown of the upper cover. Acquired by Robert Garrett from Brill, 1900.

note: Ms. codex.|Title provided by cataloger.|Physical description: 17-18 lines per page. Written in medium small taʻlīq in black ink with use of red. Contains diagrams in red and black ink. Light biscuit paper, glossy, with laid lines and chain lines, and pulp visible. Marginal annotations. Several inscriptions and short texts on pastedowns and on fol. 1a, in Arabic and Persian, including a mention of astronomical signs related to events dating to the years 1022 H. and 1073 H., from the margins of a majmūʻah. Kabīkaj on fol. 20a. Last word of verso repeated on next recto. Waqf (see inscription on upper margin of fol. 114a). Margins worm-eaten.|Origin: Text 1 and 2 copied in 884 H. [1479 or 1480] (colophons, fol. 19a and 89b). Text 3 ends on a colophon stating that it was written by the author, Kamāl al-Tūrākānī, in Gulistān, on 26 Ramaḍān 755 [Oct. 14, 1354] (fol. 139a). This appears to be the colophon of the exemplar, since the text seems to be written by the same hand and on the same paper as the two first text in the volume. See also Princeton University Library. Islamic mss. Garrett no. 505H.|Several ownership statements on fol. 1a, one dated 1111 H. Acquired by Robert Garrett from Brill, Leyden, 1925, from the books of Murād Bey al-Bārūdī (Beirut).

subject_as_recorded: Hippocrates. Aphorisms|Medicine, Arab--9th century|Medicine, Arab--10th century|Manuscripts, Arabic--New Jersey--Princeton
author_as_recorded: Rāzī, Abū Bakr Muḥammad ibn Zakarīyā, 865?-925?
author_as_recorded_agr: رازي، ابو بكر محمد بن زكريا
physical_description: Extent: 88, i leaves: paper ; 205 x 140 (135 x 85) mm. bound to 210 x 145 mm.
note: Ms. codex.|Title from title page (fol. 1a).|Physical description: 13 lines per page. Written in medium large naskh in black ink with use of red. Headings in red ink. Occasional marginal annotations. Light cream-biscuit paper, with laid lines visible ; frame-ruled. Reading statements on the margins throughout ("balaghtu qirāʾatan"). Several inscriptions on fol. 1a, including ownership statements. Pagination in pencil using Arabic numerals (starts with "3" on fol. 2a). According to the numbering of the quires, some leaves are apparently misplaced ; leaves missing between fol. 29 and 30 ; a few leaves disbound. Water stains on the margins. Worm-eaten. Extremely fragile.|Some quires (mainly quinions) are numbered in black ink using Arabic ordinals (see sā[disah] on fol. 39a; sābiʻah on fol. 49a; khām[isah] (!) on fol. 58a; thāminah on 61a; tāsiʻ[ah] on fol. 71a; ʻāsh[irah] on fol. 81a).|Inscription (partly erased) on the margin of the colophon, mentioning a Shihāb al-Dīn, dated -86? (fol. 88b).|Origin: According to colophon, copy completed on 9 Safar 681 [May 19, 1282] (fol. 88b).|Ownership statements on fol. 1a, including one in the name of ʻAbd al-Wahhāb ibn Sharaf ; one in the name of SQRṬūn (or SQʻRṬūn) Aḥmad. The same name appears in a note on the margin of fol. 22a and 38a, in the form "Darwīsh Aḥmad al-...(?) SQRṬūn". Ownership statement on the upper margin of fol. 2b in the name of Ghānim al-Bayṭār. The same name appears in an ownership statement on the margin of the colophon (fol. 88b). Acquired from Murād Bey al-Bārūdī, Beirut, 1925.

subject_as_recorded: Ibn Umayl, Muḥammad, active 10th century. Qaṣīdah al-Nūnīyah|Alchemy--Islamic Empire--Early works to 1800|Medicine, Arab|Weights and measures, Arab--Early works to 1800|Manuscripts, Arabic--New Jersey--Princeton|Manuscripts, Arabic|New Jersey--Princeton
note: Ms. composite codex.|Title supplied by cataloger, from title of main text.|Inscription "584" in Arabic numerals on the upper cover and on fol. 1a.|Physical description: The main text (fol. 21a-102a) is written in a neat medium small script in black ink with use of red, with 19 lines per page (written surface: 125 x 65 mm.). European paper with watermark. Marginal annotations. Fol. 1 and 113 are later added fly-leaves. On fol. 2b-3a is a table of contents for the main text. Foliation in red pencil using Arabic numerals on fol. 21a-102a (main text). This foliation is used in the table of contents fol. 2b-3a.|Origin: According to a note on the margin of the end of the main text, this was copied by Muṣṭafá ibn Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad al-Ḥusaynī al-shahīr bi-ZīrakʹZādah (fol. 102a).|Several ownership statements, some with seal impressions, on fol. 2a, one dated 1107 H. [1695 or 6]. Two ownership statements in the name of Muḥammad Saʻīd and of ʻAbd al-Ḥaqq, and one seal impression reading "Muḥammad" on fol. 20a.
